"Could temper the populism of the house." Sound familiar? https://t.co/HGLrBcEGV0
DJT is not (and never was) the answer, but a professional political class is not either.
Politicians want power. Full stop. Professional politicians want lifetime power. Why do we feed into that?
Interventionist foreign policy is part of the reason September 11 happened. We forget that because we believe our politicians are honorable.
At this point, I'd rather a president not know Aleppo than one who would commit Americans to die, and another who would push the Nuke button
God bless the pot smoking, banner waving, tinfoil wearing Libertarians. They tried to warn us.
We failed. We vested too much power in the presidency for expediency sake and then cried when it was used for evil.
I voted for neither because my vote should not be "choose the least bad candidate."
DJT is terrible, HRC less so. identity was touted because her machinations were repugnant. DJT is more repugnant. This was our choice?
Our military spending and our war-mongering causes us to incur more war and death, without the security our politicians say we crave.
government programs won't make us prosperous (future tweetstorm), but if we go bankrupt, I'd rather it be because of social programs.
It also hurts these social programs that America is the world's policeman. We spend hundreds of billions on others that we need for us.
We promise them either because we believe/they net votes. It's hard to say, " I can't promise you X, but I can promise a solvent country."
We have made many mistakes in good faith: social security, War Powers act, Medicaid, medicare. We promise things we know are insolvent.
Downside was people felt disconnected by political process. Of course the House is more powerful; all budgets must originate in House.
Upside of appointment was it ensured senators cared about the state's goals first, and not outside money.
Before 17th, senators were appointed by states. Led to smokey backroom dealing. Now we have shit tons of pro money in senators' elections.
It was done for the best of reasons, I'm sure. But the professional politician has gutted american's faith in them. Power corrupts.
We need politicians who are not disconnected from those they serve. 17th Amendment practically guarantees otherwise.
Make no mistake: sooner impeachment happens, better for America. Solution is not "professional politicians". We've had a century of that.
The downside to impeachment is it will be misconstrued as needing a political class. Trump election due to the political class failing us.
